intro: Diploglottis pedleyi, commonly known as the Pedley's diploglottis, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a unique floral structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
